articles.title: Lindsey Vonn says she had a ‘successful’ 3rd surgery on broken leg following crash at the Olympics
articles.description:
"Success today has a completely different meaning than it did a few days ago."

The post Lindsey Vonn says she had a ‘successful’ 3rd surgery on broken leg following crash at the Olympics appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Lindsey Vonn underwent her third leg surgery on February 11, 2026.
Vonn's recovery may inspire local athletes facing injuries in Boston.
Successful surgery raises hopes for her return to competitive skiing.

articles.title: Backflip on the podium, breakthrough on the snow, as Ben Ogden hails new generation of U.S. skiers
articles.description:
Before the Milan Cortina Winter Games, an American man hadn't won an Olympic medal in cross-country skiing in 50 years.

The post Backflip on the podium, breakthrough on the snow, as Ben Ogden hails new generation of U.S. skiers appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Ben Ogden celebrates a new era for U.S. cross-country skiing ahead of the Milan Cortina Winter Games.
An American man last won an Olympic medal in this sport 50 years ago.
Boston residents may see increased interest in winter sports and local skiing programs.

articles.title: What K’Lavon Chaisson and Jaylinn Hawkins said about upcoming free agency
articles.description:
Both players said they would like to return, but with free agency kicking off next month there are no guarantees.

The post What K’Lavon Chaisson and Jaylinn Hawkins said about upcoming free agency appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: K’Lavon Chaisson and Jaylinn Hawkins express desire to return to the Patriots.
Free agency begins next month, creating uncertainty for both players.
Potential roster changes may affect the Patriots' performance in the upcoming season.

articles.title: A Mass. middle school basketball coach collapsed during a game. The opposing coach sprang into action.
articles.description:
Belmont Middle School coach Ian Haffer is credited with saving Waltham coach Ronnie Poirier's life after he suffered an apparent heart attack courtside last week.

The post A Mass. middle school basketball coach collapsed during a game. The opposing coach sprang into action. appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Waltham coach Ronnie Poirier collapsed from a heart attack during a game last week.
Belmont coach Ian Haffer performed life-saving measures, preventing a tragedy on February 11.
The incident highlights the importance of quick action and preparedness in local sports events.

articles.title: Another movie theater is shutting down in Massachusetts
articles.description:
Showcase Cinema de Lux in Randolph will close its doors on March 1.

The post Another movie theater is shutting down in Massachusetts appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Showcase Cinema de Lux in Randolph will close on March 1, 2026.
This closure adds to the growing list of theater shutdowns in Massachusetts.
Boston residents may face fewer local entertainment options as theaters continue to close.

articles.title: Giveaway: Enter to win tickets to a screening of ‘Midwinter Break’
articles.description:
Send a question to Love Letters for a chance to get a pair of tickets to this new Focus Features film.

summary: Enter to win tickets for 'Midwinter Break' screening in Boston.

Local residents can enjoy a new film experience in February.

articles.title: From mom to maple syrup, ski racer Ryan Cochran-Siegle’s 2nd Olympic silver traces to Vermont roots
articles.description:
"I’m a representation of my entire family,” Cochran-Siegle said. “My mom had her success with her Olympics and her ski career, and I feel very fortunate that I was able to continue our spirit and love for skiing.”

The post From mom to maple syrup, ski racer Ryan Cochran-Siegle’s 2nd Olympic silver traces to Vermont roots appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Ryan Cochran-Siegle won his second Olympic silver medal, highlighting his Vermont skiing heritage.
Cochran-Siegle's success reflects his family's Olympic legacy, particularly his mother's achievements.
Boston residents celebrate local athlete's accomplishments, fostering community pride in winter sports.
